intro: Isotrema cangshanense, commonly known as the Cangshan isotrema, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan, China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly serrated edge. Isotrema cangshanense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
